intro: Chassalia discolor subsp. grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered chassalia, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, which are typically arranged in a single, terminal head. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or disturbed habitats.
